intro: Avenochloa breviaristata, commonly known as the short-bract grass, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family Poaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, including India, China, and Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. Its inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of spikelets, each bearing two to three small, spikelet-like flowers. Avenochloa breviaristata is often found in wetland habitats and is adapted to thrive in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
